importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The article was updated on this date, indicating the current relevance of military jacket fashion trends in fall 2025.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The article highlights a surge in military jacket searches in October 2025, indicating a seasonal fashion trend resurgence.
The 1960s and 1967 are referenced as pivotal decades when military jackets were subverted in fashion by artists like Jimi Hendrix and The Beatles.

keyTakeAways: Military-style jackets, particularly the Hussar pelisse, are experiencing a revival in fashion due to celebrity influence and historical reimaginings.
Celebrity appearances at fashion events — such as Jodie Turner-Smith at Victoria’s Secret and Zendaya at Louis Vuitton — have driven public interest in military-inspired outerwear.
The style has roots in 18th-century military uniforms, but modern reinterpretations by artists like Jimi Hendrix and The Beatles redefined it as a symbol of rebellion and anti-establishment culture.
Luxury fashion houses like Saint Laurent, Gucci, and Marc Jacobs have contributed to the trend through design innovations and celebrity endorsements.
Global searches for 'Hussar jacket' increased by 300% in October 2025, showing a significant public interest spike in the style.

namedEntities.name: Jodie Turner-Smith
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Celebrity and fashion influencer who wore a military-style Hussar jacket at Victoria’s Secret after-party
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is a key example of modern celebrities embracing military jackets in fashion, symbolizing the trend’s mainstream appeal.

namedEntities.name: Zendaya
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Celebrity and fashion model who wore a metallic fur-trimmed dress-coat at Louis Vuitton show
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Her look demonstrates a modern, fashion-forward adaptation of military-style outerwear with Rococo and royal references.

namedEntities.name: Jenna Ortega
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Celebrity and actress seen wearing a gothic black Hussar vest at Dior show
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She exemplifies how military jackets are being reimagined with gothic and edgy aesthetics in contemporary fashion.

namedEntities.name: Jimi Hendrix
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: American guitarist and singer who briefly enlisted in US Army and wore Hussar pelisses in the 1960s
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His subversive use of military coats helped initiate a cultural shift, turning military jackets into symbols of bohemian and anti-establishment fashion.

namedEntities.name: The Beatles
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Music group that wore military coats on the cover of their 1967 album 'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band'
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Their use of military jackets conveyed anti-war and anti-establishment sentiments, influencing the historical evolution of military fashion in pop culture.

namedEntities.name: Kate Moss
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Celebrity and model who wore a Hussar jacket to Glastonbury in 2005
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She played a pivotal role in mainstreaming the military jacket trend in the early 2000s through high-profile appearances.

namedEntities.name: Keburia
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Georgian fashion brand that sold the Hussar jacket worn by Jodie Turner-Smith
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: It is a modern brand contributing to the commercial availability and visibility of military jackets in fashion.

namedEntities.name: Saint Laurent
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Luxury fashion brand that reinterpreted the Hussar jacket with red-trimmed, gold-stitched designs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand helped popularize the military jacket trend through innovative and stylish reinterpretations in the early 2000s.

namedEntities.name: Gucci
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Luxury fashion brand that contributed to military jacket revival with creative designs
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Gucci's inclusion of Hussar jackets in its collections shows the style’s integration into high-end fashion.

namedEntities.name: Marc Jacobs
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Fashion designer who introduced a cream wool Hussar jacket in 2002 with red trim and gold stitching
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Marc Jacobs’ design is cited as a key moment in the modern revival of military jackets in luxury fashion.

namedEntities.name: Jonathan Anderson
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Designer who presented a menswear collection for Dior featuring a Hussar jacket
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His debut collection at Dior marked a recent instance of the military jacket being featured on modern catwalks.

namedEntities.name: McQueen
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Fashion brand that included military jackets in recent collections
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: McQueen's inclusion of the style reflects its current presence in high fashion.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Fashion brand that featured military jackets in recent collections
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Vaquera’s involvement demonstrates the widespread adoption of the style across different fashion houses.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Fashion brand that included military jackets in recent collections
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The brand’s inclusion shows the military jacket’s presence in contemporary European fashion.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Fashion analyst who runs the Instagram account @styleanalytics

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The event location and brand highlight how major fashion weeks drive global fashion visibility.

namedEntities.name: Dior
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Fashion brand where Jenna Ortega appeared at a show
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The show context reflects how military jackets are being reimagined in contemporary haute couture settings.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The fashion world is experiencing a revival of military-style jackets, particularly the Hussar pelisse, inspired by historical uniforms and reinterpreted through modern celebrity appearances and luxury fashion house designs. Celebrities such as Jodie Turner-Smith, Zendaya, and Jenna Ortega have brought attention to the style at major fashion events, while the influence of 1960s icons like Jimi Hendrix and The Beatles — who used military coats as symbols of rebellion — continues to shape its cultural significance. Designers like Marc Jacobs, Saint Laurent, and Gucci have helped popularize the trend in high fashion, and recent collections from Dior, McQueen, and Ann Demeulemeester confirm its enduring appeal. Data from fashion analyst Molly Rooyakkers shows a 300% increase in global searches for 'Hussar jacket' in October 2025, indicating strong public interest and market momentum.
title: Look of the Week: From Jimi Hendrix to Jodie Turner-Smith, why fashion loves a military jacket
